name: Axel Hotel Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff was pleasant but only concerned about getting us to upgrade our room. when we got to room we thought maybe we should have upgraded cause it was very small with no closet nor dresser instead just a wire contraption to put clothes on top of. in the heart of gay neighborhood so great location for us. towels were old so we had to go out and buy one. you can't access the spa without paying extra. breakfast not included. roof pool area was nice though the hot tub wasn't heated.
reviews.title: Not a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at an Axel Hotel and it was terrific. I had read that the room were a bit small but we had a premium room and it was great. The service was outstanding and everyone was always smiling and willing to help. The bars were great and lively. The only negative was on our final night the bars ran out of premium vodka, don't know why they couldn't get more but overall it was great.
reviews.title: First time at Axel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 10 days at the Axel Again in april!! Absolutely marvellous Time! We asked for thé same room as last time and they did everything they could to make That possible!
reviews.title: Another great stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted with free drinks as it was our birthday!
reviews.title: Very Central and Professional Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thé hôtel staff are very friendly and helpful and always with à lovely smile
reviews.title: Nothing like the photos!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you go to Barcelona, stay at Axel. The staff are ABSOLUTELY amazing. From the front desk to each of the bars and everyone in between, the service and the attention were as good as it gets. Our room had amazing sunlight, ample space, super-comfortable bed/bath/shower, and great views and enabled us both to sleep like babies. The location cannot be beat. I felt more like a guest in someone's home than a tourist at a hotel.
reviews.title: I've never felt like such a special guest in such a fine place, and each guest with whom I interacted shared my sentimen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: In addition to the impressive staff, the hotel itself was stunning and so very comfortable. The pool was great, the restaurant service (and entertainment) was top-notch, and everything was within steps of the front door.
reviews.title: Really Disappointed - no window, no blanket for 8 days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering the actual accomodation, the staff and the location, there is no other place to stay in Barcelona as far as I am concerned. I'll return for another visit ASAP.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Barcelona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THANK YOU AXEL HOTEL for such a great experience in Barcelona!!!!
reviews.title: Above the call of duty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel 100+ days a year and I have been in Barcelona four weeks this year alone. This was the worst hotel I have ever been in Barcelona. The staff was kind but the hotel was not comfortable. The rooms are missing basic ammenities.
reviews.title: Grea location but disappointing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are repeat visitors, but were very disappointed by our latest stay.
reviews.title: Great location and concept, but small rooms and nickel and dimed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid extra for an upgraded, new room (not a standard room, but not the top level suite either). However, it's hard to see what's upgraded about it. There is no closet, only an open rod to hang clothes. there are a total of two small drawers to put away clothes. The new rooms also lack a bathtub. We are thus living out of our suitcases for our five-day stay.
reviews.title: Unhonest and untidy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Perhaps our largest criticism is the Internet policy. Do not believe what they say -- Internet is "free" for one device for one person. This is an absurd policy in this day when you have couples traveling together and most people have multiple devices. If you want to add another device, it's an extra daily charge. And they are wrong that it's only one device at a time. You cannot simply rotate devices through - once a device has used a code, the code cannot be used on a different device later. This is incredibly frustrating and I lowered the rating by an entire star because of it. To use our laptop, cell phone and ipads would cost us a small fortune. VERY deceptive practices.
reviews.title: Dont believe the hype!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't believe the website. This hotel is not a good value and had an unfriendly staff. In addition to trying to overcharge us for everything, they presented a bill in US dollars rather than Euros and said I didn't have a choice -- of course the exchange rate they offered had me losing 6 cents for every dollar compared to the rate at the time. I am sure there is a law against this but after 2 nights in that place we wanted to just get out without having to beg again for an iron, towels or internet service.
reviews.title: Cool hotel however so was the atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice enough hotel, clean, very presentable but certainly overpriced ( €20 for 2 Malibu and coke in the skybar - really? ).
reviews.title: Not worth the money! Bad service
Gay Luxury Boutique Hotel: sadly an oxymoron. When will "gay" hotels become more than a glorified bathhouses?
reviews.text: My partner and I recently stayed at the Axel Hotel, after completing an all gay cruise of the Mediterranean. We were familiar with the hotel and its location, having stayed at a nearby location on previous trips. The convenient location is one of the best things Axel Hotel has going for it, as well as the hotel's roof-top deck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the hotel management doesn't appreciate what makes a truly fine, boutique hotel .... and I personally resent the "hetero-friendly" ... i.e., gay ... target audience being an excuse for poor service and amenities. Yes, the hotel has some things going for it ... but multiple little things became quite annoying ... such as 1) one very small bar of soap per room, slightly larger than a postage stamp, which is fewer and smaller than the two condom packages conveniently provided (had to ask for more soap, though I noticed condoms were replaced readily, without having to ask) 2) absence of any blankets or bedspreads (had to ask twice, before finally going downstairs to main desk to request one, which was provided reluctantly) 3) only two smallish size bath/shower towels per room (which were harder to come by than the large beach towels on the sun deck) 4) sporadic, infrequent availability of a concierge to make dinner reservations, even during the daytime 5) tacitly facilitated cruising areas...
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you're looking for a gay experience, and can tolerate the attitude and inconsistent service and amenities ... this spot may satisfy please you. If you are not youngish and gay ... or if you're an experienced traveler who looking for something more than a trendy, glorified bath-house, skip the Axel ... and stay at one of the nicer hotels in Barcelona that understand how to satisfy and indulge a traveler.
reviews.title: On The Whole, Really Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing this hotel has going for it is location.
reviews.title: As always very nice, beautiful and relaxing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my first night, I ordered a chicken ceasar salad from room service. Can you believe the croutons were toasted (stale) generic white bread?
reviews.title: Great Stay - Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Axel hotel is a very glamorous hotel, it is big, lots of rooms, modern and clean. Staff where helpful though they are busy, it is a popular hotel, but having said that they run very efficiently for a large busy hotel. The day staff are more friendly and helpful than the night staff. The rooms were clean and well equipped, the bathrooms clean and well stocked, nice towels. The hotel is centrally located. The roof top bar and pool excellent. The drinks a bit pricey but when on holiday in such a great place OK to splurge. I sued the gym and pool and spa, all we good. I would go back again an recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Glamour and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I picked the Axel based on the website. Big mistake.
reviews.title: Very Mixed Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: On the plus side, the view from the roof pool is stunning, and our superior room had a beautiful little stained-glass enclosed seating area. And the location is amazing. Other than that, not so much.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The bathroom was so poorly over-designed that taking a shower resulted in water all over the floor. High design is nice, but not if it doesn't function. The point of a shower is to keep the water inside. We ended up needing at least two of the sandpaper-like towels to soak up the water on the floor after every shower. Our decor included really tacky "hot guy" contact paper covering the safe, and a malfunctioning "hot guy" light fixture on the wall that randomly lit up and then went out until we figured out how to unplug the thing.
reviews.title: Excelent Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Very little storage space, even in one of the larger rooms.
reviews.title: Good gay hotel in heart of gay district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: Arrived on a Thursday and took the Aerobus from the the airport. Wasn't too bad, but we did have 4 bags, and the bus does get crowded. Cost around 3.60 euros for each person On the way back we took a taxi. It cost us about 22 Euros.
reviews.title: Partner and I loved it! It was our place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: The hotel was nice...we enjoyed...we have a city view, though it rained mostly when we were there. THe nice thing about the hotel was it was gay oriented. They did have internet in the room for a fee, but there are 2 computers on floor 1, that you can use, without a charge.
reviews.title: I liked it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, just two blocks from gran via and few blocks from la Rambla.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: In the heart of the gay zone of Barcelona.
reviews.title: An extraordinary experience to enjoy Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great design, great front desk team, great SPA, very clean rooms,
reviews.title: Nice, clean and friendly however requires operations manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect for gay, happy and open minded people.
reviews.title: 2 Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The excellent location, staff, reservations, reception, rooms, certainly make you return to this place. I am very pleased that the staff of this hotel makes every effort to ensure that the stay always exceeds expectations. Do not forget to try the spa services and to forget everything and relax.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 10-15 September 2010 Axel suite #703
reviews.title: Not up to scratch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must agree with most of the negative reviews of the hotel. I stayed at Axel few years back and thought it was a reasonable hotel. Good location and nice roof terrace. I imagined that after the recent renovation it had become something special, but, unfortunately, not entirely true. They added one floor where the new pool terrace is situated. It's much better than before, both during the day and at the evenings (especially Wednesday-Sunday parties). Where the terrace was previously located one floor below, there are now 4 new suites, which have very large terraces (apart from room 701 which only has a small terrace). The terrace was fabulous (ours was the corner terrace) with sun loungers, nice dining area and cool lightening. If it wouldn’t have been for the terrace, I don’t think we would have stayed so long! The suite itself was nothing to write home about. Cheap furniture and decoration. Thought I had walked into an IKEA store. Floors of cheap light pine look-alike material. Furniture similar light pine material. No decorations, and already bit of wear and tear. Bed was ok, but pillows hard as stone. The hotel does not offer any alternative softer pillows. No blanket for the bead, only the bed sheets which became a problem. The floor-to-ceiling windows were obviously a great feature and the curtains effectively blocked out all the light in the morning (and no disturbance from the traffic). But they didn’t block out the heat from the sun! So, around 10 in the morning the whole suite was boiling! The AC was by far effective enough. Some sort of remedy was to keep AC on coldest temperature during the night; with result we froze during the night due to lack of a blanket (only managed to get an old moldy blanket after the weekend). The bathroom was fine with a shower, bathtub and separate toilette, but the amenities were minuscule and there was no soap dish or anything else to place them in the shower. Most of the staff at the reception were really snobbish and not overwhelming enthusiastic. No help with the luggage. Concierge service? When? Think saw him most of the time during the evening parties on the terrace. The majority of the other staff was great and very friendly. Room service was good. Nice cocktails and food satisfactory, but nothing spectacular. The hotel had a great gym! Another stunning experience was on our final day. Our flight left in the evening. Since hotel wasn’t full we asked to keep our room. It was free of charge until 2 pm but after that we would have to pay 50% of the daily room charge. We asked if we could take a shower in the gym before leaving and it was ok, for an Euro 25 charge per person. Or we could, free of charge (how generous!), use the open shower on terrace next to the pool, and change in the toilette!! Oh my God! To conclude: I’m not sure the huge terrace in the suite can make up for the price the hotel is charging (in level with some 5 star hotels in the neighborhood). The evening parties on the pool terrace are in any case available for everyone, so would recommend staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 days and loved every minute of it! Word of advice, book in advance and pay in full for lowest possible rate. Loved the hotel and the proximity to so many great restaurants and shops. 10 minute walk to Placa Catalunya.
reviews.title: Great for friends to getway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Make sure you are sharing a room with someone you know well as the lack of privacy when showering could come as a shock to some.
reviews.title: No gay hotel any more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hands down, most fun hotel I've ever stayed in!
reviews.title: Trendy but no duvet or blanket!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Axel in 2008 and returned again in September 2011. I liked the Axel the first time, but I love it now.
reviews.title: love the Axel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ricardo at the front desk was terrific. Coming from New York, our plane landed early morning and we arrived at the hotel before any rooms were available for check in. He secured our luggage, gave us the WIFI password to have an internet connection, and advised us to get something to eat, then relax at the rooftop pool deck, and that our room would be ready no later than 2pm. We wound up getting some sun and a very refreshing nap up on the pool deck, and when we checked on the room status around 3pm, Ricardo informed us that it was ready and he had upgraded our room to a higher category. We LOVED the room. It had obviously been recently renovated, had a super-comfortable king bed, and a fantastic view out onto the street and the beautiful spanish architecture of the area. The hotel and the room had every amenity one could need. The gym/spa is fantastic, the pool deck becomes a lounge at night and is the perfect place to have a drink or three.
reviews.title: Very nice, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside to this trip was the the hotel no longer provides complimentary bottled water on each floor. This was a nice touch, that I think should be reinstated. But there are convenience stores nearby and a 1.5 litre bottle of water is only 1.5 Euro.
reviews.title: Good fun, great rooftop bar and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Axel is perfectly located in Barcelona. It's just a short walk to the the subway (for quick runs around the city) or the RENFE lines (if you want to check out Sitges or other places in Spain). The neighborhood is safe, picturesque, and charming.
reviews.title: Excellent and brilliantly situated hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Axel is surprisingly affordable for what you get. The bang-for-the-buck factor is very high.
reviews.title: Centrally Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Good about the “Axel Premium” room: A fabulous little balcony, with two chairs, table, and electric socket, enclosed by stained-glass windows that opened for a breeze, overlooking a typical Eixample 8-sided streetcorner. The room was bright by day (big window in addition to the balcony) yet very well insulated from street noise and light at night. Recently renovated, great bed, good climate control. Practical, no frills, easily-cleaned surfaces.
reviews.title: Wonderful room made for a pleasant off-season stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good about the area: Blocks from Passeig de Gràcia, but not overrun by the bad element that follows tourists. Plenty of food around on the two cross streets, ranging from groc shops serving locals, to super delicious dainty pizza slices, to sit-down evening tapas. Nice walk to the coast. Stylish shopping.
reviews.title: Very good gay and hetro friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: “Fun” notes: Mirror outside bathroom was angled for a view of the shower area. “Please Disturb” door tag could invite other fun-loving guests to your room. (I did not hang it.)
reviews.title: good but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad: I had a good stay - The bed, the windows, the fabulous balcony made up for the hotel's flaws. But these were numerous. Malfunctioning internet. Cleaning staff ignored the “L” door tag and serviced other rooms before mine. “Barcelona City Card” rate did not include the card itself, but rather a voucher that I failed to redeem because I would have had to wait in line a long time in the tourist information dungeon, and I preferred to cut my losses and just go out and be out in the ambient.
reviews.title: Almost Perfect !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We only stayed 1 night (cost 120E) but it was very comfortable. Very modern decor, great bed, helpful staff who spoke very good English. The 8th floor Sky bar, pool, hot tub was enjoyable but the service at the Sky bar wasn't great. We arrived at 9:30 am could only check in at 2pm so they keep our luggage behind the desk. It would have been nice to have a room sooner but I guess they were really full. At the time (Oct 1 2010) , Internet was free so that was an added bonus.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best choice in Barcelona!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very good situation, near the gay district, near the touristic, in the middle of all the touristic places 5 Sagrada familia, Las Ramblas, Gaùdi buildings, Montjùic... A little far away from Barcelonneta beach, by walk, subway is better for this place.
reviews.title: Wonderfull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, friendly, and quiet. The roof top is very good, but too small, because it success. The rooms are nice, large, and lightening. The staff is particulary friendly, particulary the receptionist called Ricardo.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one bad points: the dressing in the room are not really esthetical ( open dressing, clothes are on view) and functionnal.
reviews.title: do not let them book you a taxi-RIP OFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The clim is too cold.
reviews.title: Way overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: A recently updated and modernized hotel in a great part of Eixample district. They advertise as being "hetero-friendly" and indeed there were many male-female couples staying there. The roooms were big, clean, bright and my room had a great balcony big enough to walk out on and the suites on the 7th floor have their own large kitchen-sized tables with 4 chairs and room for more.
reviews.title: The new Axel looks great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Axel in November. We stayed in two other hotels in Barcelona, and this was by far our favorite. Staff was very helpful in pointing out attractions and also recommending great restaurants in the neighborhood. Gym is small, but has everything you'd need. Library has free Internet access. The restaurant in Hotel Axel was excellent. We dined there our last evening in Spain and were shocked at the culinary delights. Try it for more than breakfast.
reviews.title: Great hotel - even for heteros!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We did not feel out of place as heterosexuals in a "gay" hotel. Patrons were nice, staff was helpful, and the location is convenient. The rooftop bar and pool were off season when we were there, but I bet it's a fantastic time. Enjoy this modern hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: My partner and I arerived at the Axel early in the morning off a cruise ship from Ft. Lauderdale We were very impressed by the pleasant staff who suggested we have breakfast in the restaurant whice our room was made ready. Our experiences in gay hotels have not been the best, but the Axel appeared to be a step above any of the others.
reviews.title: Reservation for 5 nights and checked out after just one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: We were taken to our room which was situated directly above the marque of the hotel with a nicel little balcony with an interesting view of the busy streets and the people passing by. The room was nice with a wonderful king-sized bed. The room was very clean and although the bathroom was lacking in storage space, by European standards, it was better than ok.
reviews.title: Deceptive and dishonest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Axel in Berlin two years ago and was excited to introduce my friends to the Axel chain, but we were all severaly disappointed by the Barcelona version. None of the style nor friendliness of the Berlin version. Site says the Barcelona hotel was renovated 2 years ago, but the rooms don't show it. The pool area looks nothing like the pictures, the hot tub was never hot and they want to charge you extra for everything including entrance to the spa which they advertise on the site! The biggest dissappointment however was the staff who were just rude. My boyfriend speaks fluent Spanish and I have studied a few years but they still would not communicate with us. When we asked to speak with the manager they wouldn't let us. Such a great country with terrific places to stay. Avoid this one!
reviews.title: Disappointed with this unfriendly place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the pool (about 3-feet deep), the breakfast, and the fitness center at the Axel. That said, I don't think the rooms are 4-star quality--no floor coverings, no closets (there's a wire rack that one would expect in a pantry), and there's nowhere to sit apart from a small desk chair.
reviews.title: Inhospitable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was also very disappointed that when I arrived two hours before check in, the front desk said my room was ready but that I'd have to pay 40 euros to enter it early. I found that utterly inhospitable.
reviews.title: heaven for gays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in the hotel many times, and always look forward to coming back. Very well received, both in reception and restaurant. Nice atmosphere around the pool and bar. Very central, both for gay activities and touristic activities
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Currently staying at the hotel and am very disappointed so far particularly with the service. I feel as though customer service is not in their language - definitely not what I expect in a four-star hotel. 1. Left our bags at the reception while waiting to check in, and when we arrived to check in, the reception staff could not find our bags after I gave them the tickets. We had to look for them ourselves. 2. We were given a gift card as a welcome gift for a local boutique, and when we went to use the gift card at the boutique, the store staff told us that the card had already been used. When I explained to the hotel reception what happened, I was given explanation that I did not find plausible. 3. I asked the reception staff Daniel at the reception if the pool and jacuzzi were open and he said yes. I went up to use the pool, and one of the terrace staff gave me a towel and said I could use the pool and I could turn on the jacuzzi. I could not figure out how to turn on the jacuzzi, and when I went to ask how, a different terrace staff member told me it was closed. No explanation was given. So I went back down to Daniel at the reception who then called up to the terrace and gave me an explanation. I still wasted my time going up and down and came away upset and frustrated, which I told to Daniel at the reception who really did nothing to make me feel like a valued customer at the hotel. It is disappointing that this hotel has not lived up to its reputation.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location...especially for party boys. The Saturday night drag show on Saturday night downstairs was hilarious!! Good quality hotel with all the mod cons, and funkified design glamour. Rooftop (plunge) pool a great treat and option to the beach...although we LOVED the beach at Barcelonata. We were surprised at all the hetero couples staying....I guess they are onto a good thing....though I wonder what they think about the 'Please disturb' signs you can place on your door!! LOL
reviews.title: Great Barcelona Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from 3 days at the Axel hotel and thought it was awesome. We are not gay but loved the look of it so thought we'd give it a go and are sooooo glad we did!!! We arrived around 11am on Saturday morning and the service was second to none. They put our bags away so we could go out for the afternoon as we were far too early for check-in. The guy at the desk noticed we had booked a twin room and when he questioned this we told him not to worry and that we would push the beds together! He then immediately told us that he would see to this for us. Having spent an amazing afternoon strolling round the shops we got back to find that they had upgraded us to a superior room with a double bed!!! We then learnt it was Ricardo we had been dealing with and I couldn't fault the service. In fact, I couldn't fault the service of any of the staff but unfortunately didn't take a note of their names!! The room was lovely, clean and modern and having the balcony was great. On the Saturday evening my partner proposed to me in our room at the Axel so obviously this hotel will always hold a special place in my heart. With regards to the hotel being "heterofriendly" this was clearly the case. We did not feel that we were the odd ones out at all and felt at home for our entire stay. People that have complained previously about ridiculous things must have nothing better to do!! And I would question their attitudes towards the staff that may have led to receiving less than perfect service. We were just so happy to be spending a few days away from work and normality and I'm sure that happiness rubs off on people. My motto is to treat people as you wish to be treated. We were courteous and received nothing but courtesy in return. I would highly recommend the hotel. The location is great, just 10 mins walk from Ramblas and far away to be able to get a good nights sleep (please ignore the comments about noisy bin collection - don't we get this anywhere???!!!). The bed was so comfortable!!! My only teeny tiny niggle was that it would have been nice to have coffee making facilities in the room - having said that, this wasn't a problem once we realised that they serve breakfast up until 12!!) Anyway, thanks to all the staff who made us feel so welcome and we will definitely be spending our anniversaries here in the future!!!
reviews.title: Chillaxel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: we stayed in a premium room and it was pretty good (well, for the price it should be); an emergency light above the door and adjacent to my head on the bed was extremely irritating iluminating the room and disturbing our sleep. also, the humming from the toilet was also annoying.
reviews.title: cost cutting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: reception service was abysmal; not because the staff themselves were bad - they were just overstretched; ie only ever one person per shift; that's to take calls from customers, check in and check out, answer questions etc...........there was always a line of people waiting to be attended............
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: WIFI hardly ever worked in the room which is just not acceptable these days !!!!! it didnt work in the lobby either - many other customers were pissed off as well!!!!
reviews.title: Good Hotel , comfortable and enjoyable

description: From August 2013, Axel Hotel Barcelona enters the path of development and to contribute our concern about the environment! As a reference for the international tourism, Axel Hotel Barcelona is certified as sustainable property.
